intro: Harpalyce retusa, commonly known as the smooth harpalyce, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. Harpalyce retusa is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
